properties.areaDesc: San Luis Obispo County Central Coast; Santa Barbara County Central Coast
properties.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 10 at 2:06PM PST until January 13 at 6:00AM PST by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
properties.description:
* WHAT...Large breaking waves of 12 to 15 feet with local sets to
17 feet. Strong rip currents and sneaker waves.

* WHERE...West to northwest facing beaches of the San Luis
Obispo County and Santa Barbara County Central Coast.

* WHEN...From 6 PM Saturday to 6 AM PST Monday.

* IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip
currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large
breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and
rocks, and capsize small boats near shore.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...An above normal high tide of 6.5 feet late
Sunday morning will result in the possibility of localized minor
coastal flooding at that time over low-lying coastal areas such
as beach parking lots and harbor walkways. No significant
damage is expected.
properties.instruction:
Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay
near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in
such conditions, stay off the rocks.

NWSheadline: HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM SATURDAY TO 6 AM PST MONDAY
